editorialSummary.text: Bright quarters in a polished high-rise hotel with a sleek restaurant & a bar, plus a 24-hour gym.

originalText.text: Our stay at the RIU Plaza New York Times Square was good but the room was not very well appointed. It was however clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included and it was satisfactory. It is fairly easy to walk to most of the iconic attractions if you are of average fitness.

text.text: Our stay at the RIU Plaza New York Times Square was good but the room was not very well appointed. It was however clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included and it was satisfactory. It is fairly easy to walk to most of the iconic attractions if you are of average fitness.

originalText.text:
Location is the best thing about this hotel. It’s within walking distance of most things a tourist would need/ want to see in NYC and has good transport links. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfy. The breakfast was good, albeit a little chaotic.
However, there were some major flaws too. First, we had to pay a $130 tax which was completely unexpected on check in. Secondly, there were a lack of basic facilities in the room, for example the ability to make a tea or coffee. There was a large crack in the shower tray which kept leaking and large black scuffs on the white panels across the room. The choice of purple accents in the room made it look a little tacky. The fridge they provided was completely empty and barely cold; there’s no point of it even being there.
With regards to the staff, although the bell boys and concierge were helpful, the front desk lady not so much.
Another red flag we noticed was the protesting of construction workers outside the hotel. It makes me concerned with how little the staff are being paid there.

originalText.text:
Very loud. I know it’s Times Square but on the 14th floor you shouldn’t hear people shouting on the street. A new hotel should have decent windows and soundproofing.

Room is quite small but comfortable. Only harsh blue LED lights. Very cold plastic flooring. Bathroom has only a sliding glass door so not much privacy if you need it.

Room is quite small but comfortable. Only harsh blue LED lights. Very cold plastic flooring. Bathroom has only a sliding glass door so not much privacy if you need it.

originalText.text:
This hotel is well situated near time square. Nice sized room with fridge, shower, toilet, large TV, hair dryer, ironing board and iron.

For any British people visiting there is not tea of coffee making facilities. Make sure you take a travel kettle and don't forget you plug adapter.

We also had breakfast included in our stay which help reduce the cost for food.

The hotel has a good selection of breakfasts item, including fruit, yogurt, pastries and donuts, bread for toast,cerials, bacon, eggs, sausages, pancakes, waffles fried tomatoes, tea, coffee, orange and apple juice

The is also a small coffee shop that does a good selection of drinks and salad boxes and sandwiches, these are reasonably priced considering it's quite expensive in New York.

If you feel the need to work out there is also a small gym.

Please note you will have to pay a resort fee of $39 a day and you will have to pay a $200 refundable deposit which you will.get back when you check out.

originalText.text: This hotel is in a perfect location! There are so many restaurants within walking distance. Times Square was just a couple of blocks away. For NY, the rooms were a reasonable size. The family double room had two beds and a pull out so my family of 5 slept comfortably. Shout out to Erick in the lounge for excellent service.
